zone.line: They are accustomed also to sacrifize an ox,
whom the Egyptians worship as Apis. They
abstain from swine in remembrance of the
destruction brought upon them formerly by
the deisease to which that animal is liable.
They still preserve the memory of their famine
in the desaert by frequent fasts. And the
ulnleavenlend bread which the Jews are accustomed
-tomed to use is a record of the corn hastily
appropriated by rapine. It is said, that
they abstain from labour on the seventh
day, because that formerly was the term
of their wanderings; then, improving the
excuse for idleness, they dedicated every
seventh year to the same indulgence.
Others attribute that hon institution as in
honour of Saturn, whether because the Idaei who
were expelled with Saturn, & were the founders
of the nation, or because, the planet Saturn
in is borne in the widest orbit, & the principal
